result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander T Bernal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:06 p.m.  Defendant in custody present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Roeth has received a copy of the revocation packet, notes one corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA Vanden Branden.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF37 / 2016CM71 / 2016CF95 (EACH)

-30 days county jail on each case, consecutive to each other and any other sentence.
-Court orders the costs of $443 on 2016CF37, $443 on 2016CM71 & $453 on 2016CF95 be reduced to civil judgments. 
 
Court grants the defendant 158 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.

records.addlTxt:
11:26 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to:  2016CF37 count 1 amended to misdemeanor possess THC, will plea to count 1 in 2016CF75, dismissing the place enhancer, will plea to count 4 in 2016CF95 and count 1 in 2016CM71, with probation.  All other counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on:  the amended count 1 on 2016CF37, count 1 on 2016CF75, strikes the place enhancer and count 4 on 2016CF95 and count 1 on 2016CM71.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF37 (Count 1) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

2016CF95 (Count 4) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants the defendant 55 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

2016CM171 (Count 1) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

2016CF75 (Count 1) - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-3 months county jail, to commence immediately.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 11:46 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.

2:37 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - requests an adjournment but may be some outstanding Discovery.  Court sets for lea & Sentencing on November 15, 2016 at 11:00a.m. 

Court adjourned at 2:28 P.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

11:52 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - have Discovery and offers in the cases and need to talk with the District Attorney as offers were made before the new charges in 2016CF95.  Court sets for P & S on November 1, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:54 a.m.

1:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - needs to do waiver of preliminary hearings on 2016CF75 & 2016CF95.  Statement by Atty Roeth - defendant will waive the preliminary hearings.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an informations with the court.  Attorney Roeth and defendant acknowledge receipt of the informations and waives any reading.  Atty Roeth enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
Status hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:28 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - defendant will waive the preliminary hearings on 2016CF75 & 2016CF95 tomorrow. 

Court adjourned at 10:30 a.m.
Status hearing on August 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

1:10 p.m.  Court calls all cases.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  2016CF95 - Atty Roeth confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5000.00 cash bond.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on August 29, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.
